Sentencas: Time of flight secondary ion mass spectrometry (TOF-SIMS) is a well-established technique for the chemical surface and depth analysis of inorganic functional materials.
Titulo: Combining high temperature electrochemistry and time of flight secondary ion mass spectrometry: Quasi in situ study of lanthanum strontium chromate manganate electrodes

Sentencas: Here we report in detail on the changes in the surface composition of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) thin film model electrode, namely lanthanum strontium chromate manganate (LSCrM, La0.64Sr0.36Cr0.68Mn0.35O3-delta), on yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) as solid electrolyte, upon electrochemical polarisation.
Titulo: Combining high temperature electrochemistry and time of flight secondary ion mass spectrometry: Quasi in situ study of lanthanum strontium chromate manganate electrodes

Sentencas: The electrochemical experiments were performed in the TOF-SIMS analysis chamber allowing fast analysis directly afterwards.
Titulo: Combining high temperature electrochemistry and time of flight secondary ion mass spectrometry: Quasi in situ study of lanthanum strontium chromate manganate electrodes

Sentencas: Changes in the electrode surface composition occur already after sample annealing in air, i.e. strontium and lanthanum diffuse to the top of the LSCrM electrode and onto the free YSZ surface.
Titulo: Combining high temperature electrochemistry and time of flight secondary ion mass spectrometry: Quasi in situ study of lanthanum strontium chromate manganate electrodes

Sentencas: By applying either a cathodic or an anodic potential to the electrode, enrichment or depletion of the different cation constituents on both the LSCrM and free YSZ surface were observed.
Titulo: Combining high temperature electrochemistry and time of flight secondary ion mass spectrometry: Quasi in situ study of lanthanum strontium chromate manganate electrodes

Sentencas: These redistribution phenomena are partly reversible several times upon switching the electrical potential of the LSCrM electrode.
Titulo: Combining high temperature electrochemistry and time of flight secondary ion mass spectrometry: Quasi in situ study of lanthanum strontium chromate manganate electrodes
